conclusion: Need to analyze flow direction and placement of baffles to determine which container liquid will flow into.
Baffles A, B, and C are placed to block direct path of liquid.
Liquid will have to flow around baffles.
Baffle A is positioned horizontally across the top part of the image.
Baffle A will likely cause liquid to flow downward.
Baffle B is horizontal and positioned lower than Baffle A.
Baffle B will similarly cause liquid to flow downward.
Baffle C is vertical and positioned on the right side.
Baffle C will cause liquid to flow to the left.
After passing through Baffle A, liquid will flow downward.
After passing through Baffle B, liquid will continue to flow downward.
After passing through Baffle C, liquid will flow to the left.
Liquid will first pass through Baffle A and then Baffle B, causing it to flow downward.
Liquid will then pass through Baffle C, causing it to flow to the left.
Container D is located to the left of the baffles and can receive the downward-flowing liquid.
Liquid will flow into Container D after passing through baffles A, B, and C.
